title: Car slams into Christmas market in Germany, killing 2 and injuring dozens
description: The suspected driver, a 50-year-old man from Saudi Arabia, was arrested on the scene. He arrived in Germany in 2006 and had worked as a doctor, local officials said.
author: Karla Adam, Souad Mekhennet, Mikhail Klimentov
byline: Karla Adam, Souad Mekhennet, Mikhail Klimentov
excerpt: The suspected driver, a 50-year-old man from Saudi Arabia, was arrested on the scene. He arrived in Germany in 2006 and had worked as a doctor, local officials said.
text: A driver plowed a car into a crowd at a Christmas market Friday evening in Magdeburg, Germany, killing at least two people, an adult and a child, and injuring nearly 70.The suspected driver, a 50-year-old man from Saudi Arabia, was arrested on the scene. He arrived in Germany in 2006 and had worked as a doctor, local officials said.
html:
A driver plowed a car into a crowd at a Christmas market Friday evening in Magdeburg, Germany, killing at least two people, an adult and a child, and injuring nearly 70.

The suspected driver, a 50-year-old man from Saudi Arabia, was arrested on the scene. He arrived in Germany in 2006 and had worked as a doctor, local officials said.
